title: I don't understand.
body:
Kindred is a niche champion, whose kit is fun and interesting, she can make awesome team-preserving plays, tricky wall hops, relies on adventure-hunts for strength instead of kill hunting or AFK farming, and oh so much more.
She isn't in the meta right this second, and thats okay! With 140ish champs, not everyone can be in the top spot ALL the time.

_"But we better rework her! she's a problem to the game, and her playstyle is detrimental to the fun of the community.."_

_"Dont worry though! We are leaving **Jax**, the poster-boy of everything great about this game, exactly as he is, because he is the new modern breed of interesting champion we want everyone to play!"_

Like, really? 
Is Kindred actually a worse champion than Jax?

Like sure, I understand if you think Kindred's kit _(or that of any champ)_ could be improved, but is changing a _newish_ niche champ with an already unique and  interesting kit, really a higher priority than updating a clearly outdated and overly simplified Jax?

The number of interesting champions doesn't go up when you update the champions that are already interesting.

I really don't understand this logic. :(

replies.body: Because kindred is absolute trash at the moment and instead of buffs Riot have turned to reworks because apparently they can never get a champion right the first time they design it, just look at Ryze hahaha.
Isn't she getting an update next patch with infinite scaling range and damage though?

thats what I mean.
Im sure it'll be cool, but why update her?

She doesn't exactly seem like the most needed champion to update.
Its weird.
